text: Scinax rossaferesae is a frog. It lives in Brazil. Scientists have seen it in and around Guartelá Canyon. The adult male frog is 27.8–31.6 mm long from nose to rear end. The iris of its eye is gold or yellow in color. Parts of its legs are light brown. The scientists who wrote the first paper about this frog named it after their friend Dr. Denise Rossa-Feres, a zoologist. ==References== Category:Frogs of South America
title: Scinax rossaferesae
